headline: Intel to reveal tech details on forthcoming PC chip, sources say
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Intel plans to release technical details about its forthcoming chip for laptops, known as Panther Lake, on Thursday, four sources briefed on the plans told Reuters.  It is part of an effort to reassure investors about Intel's first product made entirely using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A, the sources said.  The Panther Lake chips are the company's high-end mobile processors that are typically included in more expensive laptops and are the first high-volume Intel products to use the 18A process that the company has spent billions developing.

headline: What's driving the latest bout of AI deals? Analyst answers.
summary: Moor Insights & Strategy founder, CEO, and chief analyst Patrick Moorhead and Futurum CEO Daniel Newman discuss the AI milestones that could push Big Tech companies and hyperscalers even farther, including meeting compute capacity and demands, amid the latest round of artificial intelligence deals and partnerships. Also catch Daniel Newman and Patrick Moorhead weigh in on whether bubbles are forming in the AI trade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Top analyst ‘very concerned’ about Nvidia fueling an AI bubble and a ‘Cisco moment’ like the dotcom crash: ‘We’re a lot closer to the seventh inning than the first or second inning’
summary: "The guy at the epicenter [is] basically starting to do what all ultimate bad actors do in the final inning," Morgan Stanley's Lisa Shalett tells Fortune.

headline: AI companies are looking 'sturdy' as 'little bubbles' form
summary: As major tech companies execute massive AI partnerships — namely Advanced Micro Devices' (AMD) deal with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT), and Nvidia's (NVDA) own business dealings with OpenAI, Intel (INTC), and Alibaba (BABA) — is Wall Street skeptical about a market bubble forming? Moor Insights & Strategy founder, CEO, and chief analyst Patrick Moorhead and Futurum CEO Daniel Newman chat with Josh Lipton about the "sturdiness" of Big Tech names than compared to the previous Dot-Com Bubble. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Has Super Micro Run Too Far After Surging 35% in the Past Month?
summary: Wondering what to do with Super Micro Computer stock right now? You are not alone. The company has become the talk of the investing world after a run of returns that would make almost anyone sit up and take notice. Over just the last week, the stock jumped 17.8%, and it is up 35.2% for the past month. If you have been holding on longer, the numbers are even more eye-popping, with gains of 81.8% so far this year and an incredible 1856.3% over the past five years. Even the most level-headed...

headline: 2 High-Flying Stocks to Keep an Eye On and 1 We Avoid
summary: Expensive stocks typically earn their valuations through superior growth rates that other companies simply can’t match. The flip side though is that these lofty expectations make them particularly susceptible to drawdowns when market sentiment shifts.
